prompt:
Nurse: That's good to hear. It's essential to be in the best possible health before your procedure. Now, I'd like to confirm your anticipated discharge plan. You're currently scheduled to go home after the procedure. Is that still the plan?

Patient: Yes.

Nurse: Wonderful. It's critical to have a plan in place for after the procedure. Now, I'd like to ask if you've arranged for a ride home and for someone to stay with you after the procedure. Have you been able to do that?

Patient: Yes.

Nurse: That's great to hear. It's important to have someone there to assist you after the procedure. If there's anything else you need to arrange, you still have time to do so. Now, do you have any questions or concerns that you'd like to discuss?

Patient: No. None that I can think of.

Nurse: Alright. If you have any questions in the future, don't hesitate to ask. To summarize, before your procedure, you'll need to use the chlorhexidine scrub the night before and the morning of your procedure. You also need to stop eating and drinking after midnight before your procedure. Can I count on you to do all of this?

Patient: Yes.

responses.gpt4: Thank you, I have full confidence in you. Remember that I'm here for you every step of the way. If you have any questions, you can call me back at any time. The number is 641-381-6523. Do you have any other concerns or anything else on your mind that you'd like to discuss?
responses.our_model: That's wonderful. Remember, we're here for you every step of the way. If you have any questions or concerns, you can call us back at any time. The number is 641-381-6523. I want to thank you for your time today. I know you're looking forward to those pain-free walks, and we're here to support you in achieving that goal. Take care. Goodbye.
